page.title: 01S. BAWTRY, SCROOBY
page.content: Block 1 is taken up by the disused R.A.F. camp of Bawtry and agricultural land. Block 2 contains the southern part of the market town of Bantry. This is on the A638 (The Old Great North road) and the main London-Edinburgh train route as are Blocks 6 and 10. Blocks 3 and 4 are covered by agricultural land alhtough Block 4 has some woodland. Blocks 5 and 6 are also agricultural areas with the River Ryton passing through them. Block 7 contains the small village of Scaftworth on the A631 (the Sheffield-Gainsboro road. Block 8 is also agricultural land. W. of the village is Everton. Block 9 is to the east of Scrooby and Block 10 contains the village of Scrooby. To the north of Scrooby is a road and gravel quarry. Block 11 is agricultural and Block 12 contains the N.W. tip of
